docs.title: Equinox Manual
docs.text: Welcome to the manual for Equinox, a multimedia VJ suite for TouchDesigner.

docs.title: Getting started
docs.text: About Equinox Installing Equinox Release notes Known Issues

docs.title: Sections
docs.text:
• User Interface About Equinox

  • Scenes Scenes

  • Effects Pipeline About Equinox

  • Compositing User guide for UFX

  • Grading User guide for UFX

  • Macros Latest release

docs.title: Contact & enquires:
docs.text: Email: jjwu180310@gmail.com u.nami on Discord Instagram Discord server

docs.title: Version 1.0.0-alpha (TBA 2026)
docs.text: • Initial public alpha release.

docs.title: Version 0.9.0-alpha
docs.text:
• Camera viewport & OP tree explorer
  • Scene cameras can be loaded into the camera viewport for user navigation.
  • Operator menu allows for operator tweaks within the VJ.

docs.title: Version 0.8.0-alpha
docs.text:
• UI revonation & optimisations
  • Search menu for effects

docs.title: Version 0.7.0-alpha
docs.text: • Support for projection output.

docs.title: Version 0.5.0-alpha
docs.text: • Implementation of the macro system.

docs.title: Version 0.4.0-alpha
docs.text:
• Multimedia compositor
  • Designated FX chains for each deck

docs.title: Version 0.2.0-alpha
docs.text: • New master effects chain and effects library.

docs.title: Version 0.1.0-alpha
docs.text: • Preview monitor + scene changer

docs.title: 0. Macros
docs.text: str - No definition provided Graphics Platform (RTX PC vs Mac) menu - No definition provided Motion Blur Mode menu - Critical mode selection. Read-only for macro system. GEO Render pulse - Uses linked Render TOPs / GEO workflow to stablize vectors for Optical Flow. TOPs Only pulse - Only uses TOPs generate vectors with Optical Flow. TOPs Only (+ Custom Vector Input) pulse - Uses TOPs and allows for manual vector input on 2nd input pin. WIP - POPs Vectors pulse - Will allow for POPs based workflow. WIP - World Space Vector System pulse - Will allow for world space based workflow. Coming Soon - Maximum pulse - WIP Coming Soon - Medium pulse - WIP Coming Soon - Low pulse - WIP Motion Blur Amount float - Macro for changing motion blur amount (shutter speed time). Can be increased well above 2 by middle mouse dragging, or manual entry of values. Motion Blur Samples (Quality) int - Macro for changing motion blur sample count (amount of pseudo-frames to blend). Can be increased above 128 at the cost of performance. Certain values have rounding errors, so be aware if you want to animate this value. Motion Vector Smoothing float - Macro for blurring overall vector map. This decreases noise greatly at the cost of some details. You can clean up the blur on Page 2. Blur > Refine Vector Edge settings. Reset: Macros pulse - No definition provided

docs.title: 1. Setup
docs.text: Auto Discover Render / Camera toggle - No definition provided Render TOP top - This is the Render TOP that you are using for your Raw Render. Render Camera object - This is the same Camera that you are using for your Raw Render. Geometry Method menu - Local Geometry: GEOs next to this COMP Parent Geometry: GEOs above this COMP in Parent COMP Select Geometry Path: Specify GEOs location with path All Geometry with Tag: Uses OP Tags to find GEOs anywhere in project Render TOP Geometry: Uses Render TOP's Geometry list to find GEOs Geometry Path str - Manual path to Geometry. Geometry Tag str - Manual OP Tag for accessing Geometry anywhere in the project. Very nice workflow for selectively choosing certain Geometry. Vector System menu - Determines which vector system to use. Controlled by workflow macros. Geo Sample Density menu - Changes the noise override scale to allow for larger/smaller tiling when working with various large/small Geometry scales. Geo Sample Sharpness Filter menu - Changes the way that noise material override is filtered. (This is the setting that controls the blurriness that occurs when looking along an angle near parallel to a polygon. See also: https://derivative.ca/UserGuide/Texture_Filtering WIP - Transparency menu - WIP - Looking for solution for blending transparency with material override. Likely GLSL MAT solution if anyone is interested in assisting, please reach out. Overscan toggle - Enables overscan at a rate of either 0.9 or 1.1x scale. (Used primarily for Render GEO workflow to avoid vectors at edges from popping in/out. Overscan Extend Method menu - Changes how overscan will extend. Mirror is optimal so it doesn't affect the opposite side of the image. Can be fun to experiment with for glitches. Show Delay Debug toggle - Allows for an overlay to assist with timing adjustment. Optimally adjust for your object to be in the middle of the overlay for most accurate results. Typically Vector delay is never needed. Color Delay (Index) float - Delays color pass. Vector Delay (Index) float - Delays vector pass. Reset: Page 1. Setup pulse - No definition provided

docs.title: 2. Blur
docs.text:
Complexity menu - Kernel chunk size of Optical Flow. 1x1 = Highest Quality 4x4 = Fastest Quality menu - Optical Flow's built in quality for Optimization. Gain float - Optical Flow's gain. Can be increased to make more extreme effects, but increasing Shutter Speed Length / Motion Blur Amount is recommended first. Optical Flow Threshold float - Helps filter out noise and artifacts from Optical Flow. Pre-Shrink float - Pre-Shrinks the resolution before Optical Flow TOP. (Very effective for optimization!) Shutter Speed Frame Rate menu - Current Perform FPS: Uses Perform FPS to help match dynamic FPS when rendering to Movie File Out TOPs. Project FPS: Matches Project Framerate Manual FPS: Set the frames per second manually Manual FPS int - Manual override of framerate for pseudo "FPS". Shutter Speed Length (s) float - Affects the length / intensity of the blur.

Technically: 1 = 360 degree open shutter. Samples int - Affects the amount of pseudo frames that are samples and increases quality of the blur's complexity / smoothness. Gradient Magnitude (Blur Steepness) float - Controls the steepness of the falloff curve at the head and tail of motion blur streaks. Smooth Vector toggle - Controlled by macro. Enables blurring of vector map, which can decrease artifacts at the cost of details. Pre-Shrink int - Vector smoothing pre-shrink. Filter Size int - Vector smoothing filter-size. Refine Vector Edge toggle - Enables vector edge refinement which allows you to refine the smoothing from earlier. This is used to trim the blur back to reduce the blur from spilling onto the background / other GEOs. Initial Blur int - Overall initial blur.

(Smoothens out the entire shape.) Threshold float - Threshold that trims back the initial blur.

[Trims edges off of initial blur.] Soften float - Softens the edges of the threshold. If set too high, it will appear as YELLOW in the Vector Edge debug pass, which means that it is decreasing some of your blur. If set correctly, it will show as GREEN.

[Smoothens out edges.] Post Blur int - Blurs the entire edge refinmeent pass to reduce sharp edges on vector map after the refinement blur>thresh process. Appears as RED in the Vector Edge debug pass.

[Smoothens out final pass.] Reset: Page 2. Blur pulse - No definition provided

docs.title: 3. Vectors
docs.text:
Display Vector Debug toggle - Enables vector visualizer. Vector Color Mode menu - Changes Vector Debug color modes. Alpha will affect the blending between various modes.

Constant: Single color [Vector Color] Input * Color: Multiplies [Vector Color] Vector Color: Displays RG Vector Map instead. Vector Color rgba4 - Changes color variable for Vector Debug modes. Vector Size float - Changes Vector Debug overlay sizes. Vector Style menu - Changes Vector Debug overlay styles. Vector Density float - Changes Vector Debug density (how many vector debugs are shown). Vector Max Line Length float - Changes Vector Debug maximum line length. Vector Background toggle - Enables background (useful for isolating Vector Debug for creative uses). Vector Background Color rgba4 - Background color for Vector Debug (alpha will control transparency). Reset: Page 3. Vectors pulse - No definition provided

docs.title: About Equinox
docs.text:
Equinox is a modular, multimedia application created in TouchDesigner, designed for real-time compositing, VJ-ing and audioreactive performances. Equinox implements a comprehensive workflow and interface that makes VJ-ing easier and more accessible for artists.

Equinox is a sole developer project still in alpha development.

Equinox, alpha v1.0.0.

docs.title: Features
docs.text:
• Master effects chain - Equinox has a library of effects that can be inserted into the master effects chain. These effects can be rearranged and edited.
  • Media compositor - Equinox has an integrated, multimedia compositor with adjustable decks and columns that mixes clips with the main signal. Each deck has its own designated effects chain, allowing for modular, creative experimentation.
  • Grading suite - Refined color grading tools to perfect your output.
  • Macro system - Simultaneous modulation of different parameters, with filters to affect the output signal. Each export can be enabled or disabled. Macros can be controlled by MIDI.
  • Camera viewport - Camera viewport allow for camera adjustments and scene adjustments while VJ-ing live.

docs.title: Planned features
docs.text:
• Saving/loading projects
  • Saving/loading effect presets on the go
  • Fully mappable MIDI interface
  • More integrated and configurable audio analysis
  • More control over compositing & programming clips
  • General optimisations
  • Set automatable cue points for videos
  • BPM Sync / envelopes
  • VRAM optimisation (somehow...)

I wanted to include this image because I thought it was funny

docs.title: Background
docs.text:
Equinox is a sole developer project by me (unami). I'm a 15 year-old student and TouchDesigner artist, and a creative artist for PAREIDOLIA. To support our work, consider testing our software!

Equinox was developed for PAREIDOLIA, a nightclub host delivering audioreactive, synthetic visuals and raising humanitarian aid for MAP and Gazan soup kitchens. You can view our works here!

docs.title: Compositing
docs.text:
The compositor blends multiple layers of media, such as videos and graphics, into one final output. Compositing is used for programmable visual effects and overlaying graphics. Each layer is blended with the previous layer.

The compositor, with 4 layers and multiple clips loaded.

docs.title: Layers
docs.text: A layer is a collection of compiled clips, where each layer plays one clip. Layers are equipped with their own effects chain, where effects can be applied onto the layer before blending.

docs.title: Adding clips
docs.text: To add clips, simply drag a file from a file explorer into an empty clip slot. To remove the clip, hover over the clip slot and click the "X" on the top-right.

docs.title: Mixing
docs.text:
• B — Bypasses the layer from composition.
  • S — Solos the layer, bypassing all other layers from composition.
  • X — Removes the clip and any effects in its FX chain.

The alpha slider controls the alpha of the clip.

docs.title: Blend mode
docs.text: You can customize how layers are overlayed by changing the blend mode. The blend mode determines how layers are overlayed with each other.

docs.title: Playback controls
docs.text:
The play and pause buttons, you guessed it, plays and pauses the clip.

The speed slider adjusts the speed.

The skip buttons transverse through the layer's clips. By default, it skips over empty clip slots.

The bottom slider shows the clip progress.

docs.title: Clip manager
docs.text: On the lower deck of the VJ, next to the effects library, is the clip manager. The clip manager has configurations for playback, transform and the effects chain.

docs.title: Playback
docs.text:
• Blend mode - Control blend mode
  • Speed - Adjust speed of clip
  • Trim start - How much of the clip is cut at the beginning
  • Trim end - How much of the clip is cut at the end

docs.title: Transform
docs.text:
• Translate X - Translation in the x-axis
  • Translate Y - Translation in the y-axis
  • Rotation - Degree of rotation, in degrees
  • Scale - Degree of scale

docs.title: Cue points
docs.text: TBA

docs.title: Effects chain
docs.text:
Each layer has its own effects chain, where different effects can be applied onto a layer. Effects are processed before the layer is composited.

To add effects onto an FX chain, navigate to the effects library and drag the effect onto the FX chain.

Look at this cool kalediscope!

docs.title: Effects
docs.text:
Effects are post-production tools that are designed to manipulate visuals in real-time. Effects apply filters or enhancements to change the way an image is represented.

A frame of Bad Apple, with ASCII and Chromatic Abberation applied.

docs.title: Master effects chain
docs.text:
The master effects chain is the main effects pipeline of your project. Parameterized effects can be added onto the pipeline, where you can edit the video to how you wish. Effects can be rearranged, customized, and automated.

The master effect chain with listed effects.

docs.title: Effects library
docs.text: The effects library is a collection of effects that can be applied to media. It is located on the right side of the bottom deck of the VJ.

docs.title: Adding effects
docs.text: To add an effect, navigate to the effects library (bottom-right panel), and drag your desired effect to the effects chain. The effect will be immediately applied, and you can customize it by clicking on the chevron to drop down its parameters.

docs.title: Controls
docs.text:
From left to right:

  • Dry/wet slider - Adjusts the ratio between the dry (unprocessed) and wet (processed) signal.
  • Options - Open options for effect
  • Lock - Disables editing of the effect.
  • Eye - Toggle whether the effect is active. Turn off to disable cooking.
  • X - Delete the effect from the FX chain.

docs.title: Adding custom effects
docs.text:
All effects are stored in the '/effects' directory as Components. Each effect has its cooking set to false, as to not consume resources in the background. Effect cooking is automatically turned on once applied to an effects chain.

To be recognised as an effect, it must have the operator tag 'effect', and the effect's input and output must be of a TOP type. You can copy an effects template from the '/templates/' folder.

docs.title: Exports
docs.text: yeah

docs.title: Grading
docs.text: TODO

docs.title: Installation
docs.text:
1. Download the latest files from Patreon. (available for Patreon subscribers)

  2. Extract the contents of the folder.

  3. Inside the folder, run VJ.toe.

Congratulations, you are now running the VJ!

docs.title: Macros
docs.text: The macro system is a collection of controllers that output a signal. Macros can be programmed to modulate multiple effects and parameters simultaneously, on command.

docs.title: Triggers
docs.text: Triggers are macros that have an on/off state. There are two types of triggers: momentary and toggle.

docs.title: Knobs & Sliders
docs.text: Knobs and sliders are used for fine control of parameters.

docs.title: Adding macro exports
docs.text:
To add a parameter for a macro to export to, drag the parameter onto the macro. The macro will export its signal to the parameter.

To configure a macro's exports, right-click on the macro and select 'View exports'. A window will open, showing all the macro's exports. You can enable, disable or delete them.

docs.title: Configuring macros
docs.text: To configure macros, right-click on the macro and select 'Macro options'. This will bring up a menu of parameters for the macro.

docs.title: Options
docs.text:
• Name - Name of macro
  • Color - Adjust hue of macro
  • Min - Clamp min value

docs.title: Scenes
docs.text: Equinox uses Derivative's Scene Changer to handle scenes.

docs.title: Adding scenes
docs.text:
Navigate to the explorer on the bottom deck and select the 'Scenes' tab.

Select 'Import scene .tox'. From the opened file explorer, select your scene. Your scene will be imported into the VJ.

docs.title: Deleting scenes
docs.text: Navigate to the explorer and hover over the scene you wish to delete. Click on the 'X' button on the right side of the container.

docs.title: User interface
docs.text: Equinox implements a traditional VJ user interface to allow for the ease of real-time VJ-ing in TouchDesigner.

docs.title: Pipeline
docs.text:
Equinox implements a five-stage pipeline to generate real-time visual output. Equinox utilises Derivative's built-in Scene Changer from the pallette to handle scenes. All scenes are stored in the '/scenes' directory. The scene's output is routed to the Scene Changer at the start of the pipeline.

graph LR
  A[Scene] --> B;
  B[Compositing] --> C;
  C[Master FX chain] --> D;
  D[Grading] --> E;
  E[Output];

docs.title: FX Stages
docs.text: 1. Scene - Final video corrections and color grading  2. Compositing - Media is mixed in with the source signal.  3. Master FX chain - Pipeline of effects that manipulate the signal  4. Grading - Final video corrections and color grading  5. Output - Final video corrections and color grading
